space.arim.api.concurrent

Interface SyncExecution

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EnhancedExecutor, Executor, space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable, Scheduler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSyncExecution, DefaultSyncExecution, DefaultSyncExecution

    public interface SyncExecution
extends space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable, EnhancedExecutor, Scheduler
    A service designed for multithreading via asynchronous concurrent execution and scheduling.
    Effectively a clone of AsyncExecution but with modified contract specifications.

    Specifications:
    * from Registrable: requires Registrable.getPriority()
    * from EnhancedExecutor: requires Executor.execute(Runnable)
    * from Scheduler: requires Scheduler.runTaskLater(Runnable, long) and Scheduler.runTaskTimerLater(Runnable, long, long)

    Contract:
    * from Registrable: Implementations should be registered under SyncExecution.
    * from Scheduler: Task.cancel() method implementations should properly cancel further scheduling. Also, time units are in milliseconds.
    * SyncExecution: All execution and scheduled tasks MUST run on the main thread if the application has a main thread.

    SyncExecution differs from ExecutorService in a few important ways. First, it is a Registrable. Second, SyncExecution is not necessarily a thread pool, but simply an executor and scheduler. Thus it does not specify any methods relating to shutting down, awaiting termination, or invoking other callers' submissions. Thirdly, SyncExecution enables scheduling, which simple thread pools do not.
    Author:
    A248

      • Methods inherited from interface space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable

      • Methods inherited from interface space.arim.api.concurrent.Scheduler
